YouSufferWithCognitiveDissonance
children.comment: High doses of Vitamin C can fix a case of acute carbon monoxide poisoning.
Carbon monoxide has an affinity to the hemoglobin in your blood that's 250-300x that of oxygen. TL;DR: both compete but CO wins every time
It's legit. I have the lowered CO tolerance to prove it. Simple case of I didn't know what I didn't know. It was stupid, didn't know better.
Statistic. Im questioning if rookie mistake or if it's legit story or not. Regardless I like your stories. Here's a video for thought.

children.author: mixedcase
mixedcase
children.comment: smell, and only a small part of it is CO -- it's mostly nitrogen and CO2, so it takes a little time to accumulate in the blood.
Car exhaust is pretty forgiving in terms of CO poisoning for an awake person -- unless you're trying to kill yourself. It has a distinct>

children.comment: Around where I live, racial profiling DOES exist. I know because I've seen it and been with friends when it happened.
I'd like to also mention I am a Caucasian male, 21 years old, no tattoos or any criminal history.
Well, I'd need proper background on that story to judge that haha. My point is that yes, some suck, but the majority do not
Also almost got thrown out of a Springsteen concert a couple weeks ago, was surrounded by 6 officers who berated me saying I had drugs.

children.author: Argofuckyourself
MartynMage
Argofuckyourself
children.comment: I suppose it has to do alot with where you grow up.
reporting it, because he'd rather be able to discipline people messing up than have it get worse.

children.author: MartynMage
children.comment: and I reported him to his local department, I then got a call from the guy apologising as well as a call from the Lieut to thank me for 2/3

children.author: MartynMage
children.comment: I've had more than 20 runins with the police and have never had a bad experience. One time I saw a cop pull a very illegal maneuver 1/2
I've never been pulled over actually. I've met most of the officers from our local department, and I've seen most of them abuse power.
What, did you get pulled over for something and get a ticket? Sorry I'm just so tired of seeing cops get shit for what 10% do.
I say this not from what I know from media/tv, but from personal experience.
Just because the police on the media are displayed as having no morals that does not represent the majority of employed officers.
